data.md:MetaData: Hydroclimate proxy data from the eastern tropical Indian Ocean

Mg/Ca-based SST and thermocline temperatures with 1Sigma error at different sites, their difference (DeltaT), and the average DeltaT values for different periods with 95% confidence interval (CI). Also shown are hydrogen isotope (dD) values of n-C31 alkanes relative to the standard mean ocean water (per mil SMOW) with the 95% CI (LGM values are corrected for ice-volume), the C31 n-alkane concentrations in nanogram per gram sediment (ng g-1), the Carbon Preference Index (CPI27-33) as a measure of the degree of terrestrial organic matter degradation (higher CPI reflects less degraded plant waxes and vice versa), and their 1Sigma standard deviations (SD).

from Mohtadi et al. 2014 | Globigerinoides ruber, Magnesium/Calcium ratio | G. ruber Mg/Ca | Sea surface temperature, annual mean | SST (1-12) | Calculated from Mg/Ca ratios (Anand et al., 2003) | from Mohtadi et al. 2014, 1Sigma error | Sea surface temperature, annual mean, standard deviation | SST (1-12) std dev | Calculated according to (Mohtadi et al. 2014) | Pulleniatina obliquiloculata, Magnesium/Calcium ratio | P. obliqu. Mg/Ca | Thermocline temperature | TT | 1Sigma error | Thermocline temperature, standard deviation | TT std dev | Temperature, difference | delta T | from Mohtadi et al. 2010 | Neogloboquadrina dutertrei, Magnesium/Calcium ratio | N. dutertrei Mg/Ca | Globorotalia tumida, Magnesium/Calcium ratio | G. tumida Mg/Ca | Calculated from Mg/Ca ratios (Mohtadi et al., 2011) | n-Alkane C31, δD | C31 δD | mean | Ice volume corrected | Confidence interval | CI | n-Alkane C31 | C31 | n-Alkane C31, standard deviation | C31 std dev | Carbon Preference Index of n-Alkanes (C27-C33) | CPI-(27-33) | CPI27-33 SD | Standard deviation | Std dev
Late Holocene slowdown of the Indian Ocean Walker circulation
